content: God, a Helper against the Treacherous.
To the Chief Musician; set an octave below. A Psalm of David.
For the faithful vanish from among the sons of men.
They speak deceitful  worthless words to one another;
With flattering lips and a double heart they speak.
May the  cut off all flattering lips,
The tongue that speaks great things [in boasting];
Who have said, “With our tongue we will prevail;
Our lips are our own; who is lord  master over us?”
“Because of the devastation of the afflicted, because of the groaning of the needy,
Now I will arise,” says the ; “I will place him in the safety for which he longs.”
